intro: Rhynchospora tenerrima, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetlands and marshy areas of the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green to brown in color. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in swampy or pond margins. Rhynchospora tenerrima plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
